passage_text: [ 2 syll. ka-ko, kak-o ] The baby girl name Kako is pronounced as K AA-Kow- †. Kako is used predominantly in the Japanese language and it is also derived from Japanese origins. The meaning of the name is summer rainbow. Kako is a variation of the name Keiko (English and Japanese). Kako is unusual as a baby girl name. It is not listed in the top 1000
Word of the Day: kako. Pronunciation: Click here to listen to the audio file. Meaning: the past; the past days. Japanese characters: 過去　（かこ）. Example: Kako o furikaette bakari dewa ikenai.

Name-Stats.com. Find out how popular your name is and was in years past in countries all over the globe. This web site includes first names and last names from countries such as American Names, British Names, Swedish Names, French Names, Belgium Names, and more! So if you have ever wondered about the popularity of your name or are looking for a popular baby name, this is the site for you!

What does my surname mean?. If you have ever asked this question and wondered about the origin of your last name, you will find your surname may answer one of the questions of where your ancestors lived, or what they did for a living, or what was their personality like, or how they looked many hundreds of years ago. The use of a surname was originally adopted in order to distinguish two individuals with the same first name, and, at first, these last names were not passed down to the next generation. The Japanese word for Future which has become more popular as a name since the '80s, primarily for females... [more]. MIRIYA f Japanese. MIROKU m & f Japanese. The name Miroku is the Japanese name for Maitreya, the Buddha of the Future... [more]. MIROKUMARU m & f Japanese. Means Matreiya Cycle in Japanese... A hundred stars. MONAMI f Japanese (Modern). This name can be used as 萌波 or 萌南 with 萌 (hou, kiza.shi, mebae, mo.eru) meaning bud, malt, sprout, 波 (ha, nami) meaning billows, Poland, waves and 南 (na, nan, minami, nami) meaning south....
